intro: Gnaphalium africanum, commonly known as African feather grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flower heads that are clustered in dense, fluffy tufts, giving it a feathery appearance. It is typically found in open grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Gnaphalium africanum is also noted for its ability to tolerate dry conditions, making it a hardy and adaptable species.
